citation.article-title: Caldisphaera lagunensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel thermoacidophilic crenarchaeote isolated from a hot spring at Mt Maquiling, Philippines.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Caldisphaera (Cal.di.sphae′ra. L. adj. caldus hot; L. fem. n. sphaera sphere; N.L. fem. n. Caldisphaera a hot spherical cell).
Cells are mostly regular cocci, 0·8–1·1 μm in diameter, and occur singly or in pairs.
Extremely high temperature (70–78 °C) and acidic conditions (pH 3·5–4·5) are preferred for growth.
Resistant to chloramphenicol, kanamycin, oleandomycin, streptomycin and vancomycin.
Sensitive to erythromycin, novobiocin and rifampicin.
Possesses cyclic and acyclic tetraether core lipids.
DNA G+C content of the type species is 31 mol%.
The 16S rDNA is typical of a crenarchaeote in sequence signature analysis.
Phylogenetically, the genus represents an independent lineage related to the order Desulfurococcales.
The type species is Caldisphaera lagunensis.
